item.title: Get resources missing in Resource Group using PowerShell
item.description: I’ve recently stumbled across a situation where some resource groups were missing a given type of resource. The “normal” scenario is that each resource group has a bunch of resources, and this happens for multiple resource groups owned by my team. There were some issues with some implementations, and there was no logic on why some resource groups had the resource and others didn’t. Since we are talking about hundreds of resource groups, checking one by one is out of question.

Public access vs private access ðŸ”—

Authenticated access vs anonymous access ðŸ”—

public_network_access_enabled true public_network_access_enabled false

allow_nested_items_to_be_public true allow_nested_items_to_be_public false

SP access true SP access false
